proj-gym.title: Gym Management System (Freelance)
proj-gym.description: A bespoke management platform for a local fitness center, featuring automated member tracking and an administrative dashboard.
proj-gym.longDescription: Developed as a high-performance commercial solution, this platform transitioned a local gym from manual paper-based processes to a fully digital ecosystem. Built on a Vanilla PHP architecture, the system manages high-concurrency requests for member check-ins and class scheduling without the overhead of heavy frameworks.
features: Dual-interface architecture with a public-facing Homepage and a secure Staff Dashboard.
Bespoke Membership Management system for real-time tracking of subscriptions and attendance.
Custom administrative tools for staff to manage equipment inventory and class schedules.
Responsive design ensuring accessibility for gym members on both mobile and desktop devices.
theory: Vanilla PHP Architecture: Implementation of a script-per-page model to minimize server latency and eliminate framework dependency.
State Management: Utilization of PHP Session and Cookie APIs for robust cross-page state persistence and user authentication.
Relational Database Design: Optimized MySQL schema for handling complex relationships between members, trainers, and schedules.
implementation: Security-First Design: Implementation of strong password protection using Salted Hashing (password_hash) to ensure data integrity.
Session-Based Authentication: Custom-built login system with granular access control separating User and Staff privileges.
SQL Optimization: Hand-crafted queries designed for maximum efficiency in generating real-time attendance reports.
Legacy Deployment: Deployed on an Apache/Linux environment (Altervista) with custom configuration for optimal PHP performance.

proj-1.title: GreenHabits (Web Technologies)
proj-1.description: Full-stack web platform with an enterprise architecture. Implemented with a Java Spring Boot backend, React/Vite (TS) frontend, and PostgreSQL database. The infrastructure is fully containerized with Docker and includes an advanced monitoring system with Grafana and Prometheus.
proj-1.longDescription: GreenHabits is a comprehensive full-stack application designed to track and promote sustainable living habits. The platform boasts an enterprise-grade architecture with a robust backend powered by Java 25 and Spring Boot 4.0.0, exposing a complete RESTful API. The frontend is a modern Single Page Application (SPA) built with React 19, TypeScript, and Vite, utilizing React Query v5 for efficient data fetching and state management. The entire infrastructure is containerized using Docker, orchestrating services including PostgreSQL 16 for persistent data, Redis 7.0+ for caching, and a full observability stack (Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Promtail) for real-time monitoring and log aggregation.
features: Comprehensive user activity logging and statistics tracking with an exponential level system and gamification elements.
Robust JWT-based security with token blacklisting functionality and customized security filtering.
Real-time centralized logging and application metrics visualization via Prometheus, Loki, Promtail, and Grafana.
Fully containerized deployment strategy unifying the backend, frontend, database, cache, and monitoring stack in a single Docker Compose network.
theory: Controller-Service-Repository Pattern: Strict separation of concerns in the Spring Boot backend architecture.
Observability Driven Development: First-class integration of metrics (Prometheus) and log aggregation (Loki/Promtail) in the development lifecycle.
Relational Database Design: Complex entity relationships handling users, posts, activities, events, and challenges via JPA/Hibernate.
N+1 Query Optimization: Advanced use of LEFT JOIN FETCH and DTO projection queries to resolve performance bottlenecks in ORM data fetching.
implementation: Spring Boot Actuator & Micrometer: Exposure of custom metrics and health endpoints for Prometheus scraping.
React Query (v5) & React Hook Form: Implementation of sophisticated client-side data fetching, caching strategies, and form validation.
Hibernate Query Hints: Applying fetch size hints and covering indexes (idx_activity_user_summary) to batch fetch related entities and reduce memory overhead.
Cypress E2E Testing: Exhaustive end-to-end testing scenarios ensuring critical user flows and application reliability.

Developed as part of the Human-Computer Interaction class, the goal was to aggregate various Public Engagement activities (like Social4School and AIRLab) into a single, highly accessible, and user-centric platform.

Full internationalization (i18n) support implemented to accommodate diverse users.
Native theming leveraging Bootstrap 5 variables for a maintainable and consistent design system.

Accessibility (a11y) Standards: Ensuring the platform is usable by individuals with varying abilities.
Information Architecture: Structuring complex academic department data into digestible formats.
Responsive Web Design: Adapting UI components seamlessly across all breakpoints.
implementation: React 19 & TypeScript: Building a robust, type-safe single-page application.

proj-3.title: WinHUD
proj-3.description: Desktop application for Windows developed in C# (.NET/WPF). Implements a customizable overlay for real-time monitoring of hardware data and system performance.
proj-3.longDescription: WinHUD is a lightweight, non-intrusive system performance overlay for Windows. It provides real-time monitoring of critical system metrics (CPU, GPU, RAM, Disk, Network) without cluttering your screen or stealing focus from your games. Designed with a "set it and forget it" philosophy, WinHUD automatically detects when you are gaming, adjusts its text color based on the background brightness, and stays out of your way (complete with a "Ghost Mode" where clicks pass entirely through its UI).
features: Real-Time Hardware Monitoring delivering updates every second for CPU, GPU, RAM, Disk activity, and Network speed.
Gamer-Centric Design where the overlay is totally click-through, supported by Steam detection to dynamically vary visibility.
Smart Visuals using dynamic contrast processing by analyzing pixels beneath it 60 times a second, switching between Bright Green and Dark Grey.
Multi-Monitor Support via System Tray management driven by auto-saved configuration preferences.
theory: Windows System Programming: Deep hooks for performance metrics retrieval and Window Manager interactions.
Image Processing: Real-time background analysis utilizing sub-second pixel readings for intelligent contrast detection.
Non-blocking UI Loops: Threading models separating heavy computational tasks off the UI update thread.
implementation: C# 10 & .NET 10: Targeting the latest platform performance with porting via VS 2022 extensions.
LibreHardwareMonitorLib: Utilization for granular hardware queries extending across GPU vendors like AMD/Intel/NVIDIA.
WPF & System.Drawing.Common: Core UI technologies combined specifically for on-screen pixel data captures.
Makefiles for CI/CD: Automating building, packaging, and release publication directly from a Git Bash terminal.

proj-4.title: libnumakit
proj-4.description: Advanced system library written in C (built with CMake) for memory management on NUMA architectures. Includes low-level task pooling, scheduling, and memory migration logic.
proj-4.longDescription: libnumakit is a high-performance, 'batteries-included' C toolkit designed to bridge the gap between hardware topology discovery (like hwloc) and application logic on modern multi-socket NUMA systems. It provides topology-aware allocators, low-latency synchronization primitives (MCS locks), and declarative thread affinity policies. By strictly controlling memory placement and eliminating interconnect traffic during lock contention, it solves critical performance bottlenecks like false sharing and remote allocation overheads.
features: Local-First Memory Management offering zero-overhead bump-pointer allocation and strict node binding through hugepage-backed arenas.
Interconnect-Friendly Synchronization using queue-based MCS spinlocks that spin on local cache lines, drastically reducing UPI/xGMI traffic.
Policy-Based Thread Scheduling allowing declarative pinning (e.g., compact or scatter policies) without manual bitmask manipulation.
Modular Architecture divided into Memory (hugepages, slabs), Sched (affinity, migration), and Sync (MCS, Ticket, RWS locks) components.
theory: NUMA Architecture: Understanding and mitigating latency overheads when accessing remote memory across CPU sockets.
Concurrency & Lock Design: Designing scalable spinlocks (MCS) that prevent thundering herds on cache coherence protocols.
Memory Management: Direct integration with Linux hugepages to reduce TLB misses during large-scale allocations.
implementation: C / CMake: High-performance core library compiled with strict optimizations (GCC 9+ / Clang 10+).
Hardware Locality (hwloc): Internal topological discovery and hardware abstractions.
Zero-Overhead Data Structures: Lockless bump-pointer arenas ensuring O(1) allocation time.

proj-5.title: Formal Languages & Compilers
proj-5.description: Development from scratch of a compiler in Java. Includes the implementation of a lexical analyzer (Lexer), a top-down syntax analyzer (LL(1) Parser), semantic analysis via SDT (Syntax-Directed Translation), and generation of executable bytecode for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).
proj-5.longDescription: This project involved the complete, from-scratch implementation of a compiler for a custom procedural language using Java. The architecture follows a classic multi-pass compiler design, starting with a custom lexical analyzer that tokenizes the input source code. Parsing is handled by a recursive descent LL(1) parser, which constructs a clear Abstract Syntax Tree (AST). Semantic analysis guarantees type safety and scoping rules via Syntax-Directed Translation techniques before finally generating valid executable Java Bytecode using the ASM library. This academic project successfully demonstrates a deep, practical understanding of language design, formal grammars, and the internal workings of the JVM. The target language features a C-like control flow (while, conditional cases) integrated with Prefix (Polish) notation for arithmetic and boolean expressions, supporting n-ary operators and statement grouping.
features: Manual implementation of a Lexical Analyzer (Lexer) using regular expressions and finite automata theory.
Construction of a Top-Down Recursive Descent Parser conforming to LL(1) grammar constraints.
Robust Semantic Analysis implementing Syntax-Directed Translation (SDT) for type checking and scope resolution.
Direct generation of verifiable Java Bytecode (.class files) utilizing the JVM instruction set architecture.
theory: Chomsky Hierarchy: Focus on Type-2 (Context-Free) and Type-3 (Regular) languages.
Finite Automata: Deterministic (DFA) and Nondeterministic (NFA) modeling for token recognition.
LL(1) Grammars: Formal analysis of FIRST and FOLLOW sets to ensure deterministic predictive parsing.
Syntax-Directed Translation (SDT): Coupling grammar productions with semantic actions and attribute propagation.
implementation: Lexical Analysis: Hand-coded scanner with lookahead and character consumption patterns.
Recursive Descent: Modular parser where each non-terminal is mapped to a Java method.
Jasmin Backend: Translation of high-level constructs into Jasmin assembly mnemonics.
Stack Machine Semantics: Management of JVM operand stack and local variable mapping during code emission.

proj-6.title: POSIX Operating Systems Simulation
proj-6.description: Complex multi-process simulation developed in C for POSIX environments. The software architecture leverages advanced IPC primitives (Message Queues, Shared Memory, and Semaphores) for secure concurrency management and node synchronization (Director, Worker, etc.).
proj-6.longDescription: This project is a comprehensive multi-process simulation framework developed as part of an Operating Systems course (A.Y. 2024-2025). The simulation models a post office service system with various interacting components: Director, Workers, Users, and Ticket Issuers. Structured with a modular architecture, the program relies on an intricate set of advanced System V IPC primitives to orchestrate flow and two-way communications. A parallel Main application provides a terminal-based UI where users can manage validation of the simulation's configuration or inspect generated logs. In terms of fault tolerance, the project autonomously handles fatal scenarios by generating detailed crash reports—containing CPU registry dumps—for robust post-mortem debugging across architectures like x86-64 and aarch64.
features: Realistic modeling of six distinct postal services, producing real-time analytical logs or aggregated statistics at run completion.
Separated Main application with an interactive TUI utilizing libfort to dynamically manage startup properties and monitor diagnostic output.
Advanced Error Handling structure that intrinsically intercepts panic signals (SIGSEGV/SIGABRT) to produce core dump files natively listing critical CPU registers.
Centralized distributed logging driven asynchronously by dedicated Logger processes and orchestrated through custom named pipes (FIFOs).
theory: Multi-Process Architecture: An orchestrated process tree where separate client/server logic simulates business components dealing with real-time event ingestion.
Cooperative Synchronization: Detailed design against race conditions when matching wait queues to agent windows, relying systematically on System V semaphore arrays.
IPC Primitives: Instantiation of shared memory segments and message queues mapped with precise payload definitions for guaranteed bi-directional communication.
POSIX OS native signals: Handling complex asynchronous signals to orchestrate controlled interrupts across the process hierarchy and deter zombie processes.
implementation: Modular C project split into discrete Header/Source files natively compiled with structured Makefiles branching to isolated build targets.
Integration of the inih library to automatically parse and enforce constraints exposed through external INI configurations.
System V IPC Abstractions: Extensive wrapping of raw shmget, msgget, semget (and cleanup routines) to effectively broker non-blocking messaging boundaries.
Adapted log.c library extended with multi-processing guardrails offering variable terminal-colored log severities.

proj-7.title: Algorithms & Data Structures Library
proj-7.description: C library containing manual implementation of fundamental data structures and algorithms, designed for maximum efficiency. Implements Graphs, Hash Tables, Edit Distance calculation, and sorting modules, validated through rigorous unit testing (Unity framework).
proj-7.longDescription: This project is a comprehensive suite of C libraries implementing fundamental data structures and algorithms from scratch. Developed for the Algorithms and Data Structures class, the primary focus was on maximizing time and space efficiency. The project follows a strictly Test-Driven Development (TDD) approach using the Unity framework for C, ensuring extreme robustness through intensive unit testing of each module. The implemented modules range from sorting algorithms and Edit Distance calculation for auto-correction, to generic implementations of Hash Tables with chaining, and sparse Graphs with algorithms such as Breadth-First Visit (BFS).
features: Generic implementation (void*) in C of Hash Tables and Sparse Graphs (labeled/unlabeled, directed/undirected).
Pure TDD development using the Unity framework to ensure 100% coverage of library functionalities.
Optimized and efficient Edit Distance calculation, applied to automatic text correction against a dictionary.
Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithm applied to a real-world dataset of distances between Italian cities (road networks).
theory: Complexity Analysis: Rigorous asymptotic (Big-O) evaluation of execution times and memory footprint for every implemented routine.
Design Patterns in C: Abstract interfaces and utilization of function pointers for custom hashing and comparisons to ensure polymorphism.
Dynamic Programming: Implementation of the Edit Distance problem by memoizing intermediate results to optimize performance.
Graph Theory: Computational representation via adjacency lists natively optimized for sparsely connected node topologies.
implementation: C Engineering: Structured compilation via Makefiles, ensuring clean separation between library objects and main/test executables.
Function Pointers: Building generic structures capable of storing, hashing, and manipulating arbitrary data types abstractly.
Dynamic Memory Allocation: Meticulous manipulation of heap memory (malloc/free) with strict verification against memory leaks via Valgrind.
Unit Testing (Unity C): Production of comprehensive test suites validating all pre- and post-conditions before actual algorithm coding.

proj-8.title: HCI Anime Data Storytelling
proj-8.description: Data processing and analysis pipeline developed in Python (Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks) based on a massive dataset (+130M data points) related to the anime industry. Includes modular scripts for ETL, anomaly treatment, feature engineering, and Exploratory Data Analysis to tell a story through data.
proj-8.longDescription: This project implements an end-to-end data processing and analysis pipeline to explore and visualize a massive dataset of over 130 million data points related to the anime industry (anime, characters, actors, user interactions). Developed entirely in Python within JupyterLab, the work utilizes the uv package manager to guarantee deterministic and highly efficient dependency resolution. The core of the analysis focuses not only on compiling statistics but on true 'Data Storytelling', highlighting patterns, trends, and outliers over time to offer compelling insights to domain experts and fans alike.
features: Comprehensive ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Pipeline processing raw CSV data into highly optimized Parquet format.
Deep Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) focused on identifying narrative arcs and industry-wide temporal trends.
Advanced Static Visualization via Matplotlib and Seaborn for multi-dimensional data representation.
Geospatial Analysis utilizing Geopandas and Folium to plot interactive maps related to content origination and audience spread.
theory: Data Storytelling: Structuring data-driven narratives to intuitively communicate complex quantitative insights.
High-Performance Data Storage: Transitioning from row-based (CSV) to columnar storage (Parquet) for analytical workloads.
Geospatial Topology: Principles of mapping discrete spatial data onto continuous coordinate projections.
Exploratory vs Explanatory Analysis: Shifting from open-ended data discovery to focused narrative presentation.
implementation: Pandas with PyArrow Backend: Leveraging Arrow memory format to drastically reduce footprint and speed up aggregations on 130M+ rows.
Uv Package Management: Use of Rust-based uv for millisecond-resolution of Python virtual environments and locked dependencies.
Jupyter Workspaces: Separation of concerns across modular notebooks (01_cleaning, 02_exploration, 03_story) for reproducible research.
Local Package Architecture: Installation of the analysis source code (src/) in editable mode for clean cross-notebook imports.
